intro: Cissampelos arenicola, commonly known as the sand flat sarsaparilla, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces berries that are typically orange or red in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
